userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The materials from Washington and Lee University Special Collections are made available for use in research, teaching, and private study, pursuant to U.S. Copyright law. The user assumes full responsibility for any use of the materials, including but not limited to, infringement of copyright and publication rights of reproduced materials. Any materials used should be fully credited with the source. Permission for publication of this material, in part or in full, must be secured with the Head of Special Collections.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Preferred citation: [Identification of item], Elsie Ball Wright Bowley Papers, WLU Coll. 0242, Special Collections and Archives, James G. Leyburn Library, Washington and Lee University, Lexington, VA. In some cases the citation format may vary. Please contact Special Collections staff to verify the appropriate format.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Blue sheet prepared by Betty Kondayan (7/20/99)

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Elsie Ball Wright Bowley was the wife of General Albert J. Bowley, and the sister of Jessie Ball du Pont, a benefactor and Trustee of Washington and Lee.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes correspondence (4 folders) by and about Elsie Bowley's sister, Jessie Ball du Pont, and her brother-in-law, A. I. du Pont, as well as letters and correspondence from Elsie's son, Thomas Ball Wright, Ball family members of the Northern Neck of Virginia and other members of the du Pont family. Also contains papers of General Albert J. Bowley, along with Elsie Bowley's business papers regarding her benefactions. Includes ca. 175 photographs (mainly family photos), most of which are not identified.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Many cards letters from friends and family, including Laura Bertram, Bessie, and 'Pit,' to Elsie. Also included are sympathy notes when Jessie died.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Several letters and cards written to Mrs. Bowley by friends and family, many from neices and nephews. Some of the letters are notes of sympathy after Jessie's death.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Several letters to Elsie, Thomas, and General Bowley from different members of the Ball Family. There are many letters from Edward Ball and his wife Ruth.

did.unittitle: Letters from Elsie's Son, Thomas Ball Wight

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This file contains many letters from Thomas Ball Wright to his mother, Elsie. Several of the letters are written during his times at Woodberry Forrest School and at the University of Virginia. Also included in the file are letters to Pit and Jessie.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This file consists of letters to Elsie and Thomas Ball Wright from members of the Ball family, including Minnie, 'Cousin Bland,' and Katherine Gresham.

did.unittitle: Letters from Elsie's Nieces and Nephews

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This file consists of letters from Elsie's nieces and nephews, identified as such. Many of the letters are from 'Shirley' and 'Marge and John.'

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This file contains letters from Williston B. Palmer (subject: Edgar Wright), Edgar Wright, 'George,' and Rhonda M. Wright.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This file contains letters and telegrams from an array of people. There are several letters from Mary Morris Anderson, Ella Haile, and Emma Yerby. There is also a letter from 'Bro. Barney' and letters from members of the Hoffman Family. Elsie often had folders marked 'family.'

did.unittitle: Letters Written by A.I. du Pont, 1921-1935

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This file consists of letters from A.I. Du Pont. to Elsie, Thomas Ball, A.J. Bowley, and Henry DeShields. There is also a 'suggested annual budget' for Alfred V. Du Pont.

did.unittitle: Letters from Jessie Ball du Pont

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The letters are mostly written to Elsie, but there are letters to Edward, Thomas Ball, Belle Baker and General Bowley as well. Many of the later letters to Elsie were written by Hazel Williams on behalf of Jessie.

did.unittitle: Letters to or about Jessie Ball du Pont

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This files consists of letters to or about Jessie Ball du Pont. Many of the letters are from the Alred I. du Pont Institute to Elsie. The file also consists of sympathy letters from family and friends to Elsie about Jessie's death.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The letters are from members of the du Pont Family to Elsie.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This file consists of two letters from James D. Jesse of Nuttsville, Va. and of a thank-you letter from the Woman's Club of Essex County.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This file consists of letters from the James Monroe Memorial Foundation thanking Elsie for gifts. Elsie later joined her sister Isabel in becoming a trustee of the foundation. Several meeting minutes and reports are included in the file.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This file includes letters and benefactions by several different societies and associations, including The Society of the Lees of Virgina, The National Mary Washington Memorial Association, The Eisenhower-Nixon Club, and The Northern Neck of Virginia Historial Society.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This file consists of benefactions and several progams from events such as the Dedication of the Victorine duPont Dent Memorial Clinic and the Dedication Ceremony of the Jessie Ball duPont Library at Sewanee. There are many letters rom the St. Margaret's School in Tapahannock, Virginia and the United States Military Academy.

controlaccess.corpname: University of the South. Jessie Ball duPont Library

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Society of the Cincinnati in the State of Virginia

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This file consists of benefactions and letters from the United States Military Academy, Mary Washington College, Randolph-Macon Woman's College, and the Society of the Cincinnati in the State of Virginia.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This file consists of benefactions and documents rom the James Monroe Memorial Foundation.

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: National Society of the Colonial Dames of America in the Commonwealth of Virginia

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Mary Washington College of the University of Virginia

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This file consists of benefactions from several organizations, including the British Commonwealth Nurses War Memorial Fund, Mary Washington College, and personal letters from students receiving scholarships in memory of General Bowley.

did.unittitle: Biography of General A. J. Bowley
Cards to General Bowley from Elsie and Jessie, no date
Letters to or About General Bowley

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This file consists of letters written to General Bowley and letters to Elsie about General Bowley. Most of the letters are from family and friends. General Bowley and Elsie's engagement accouncement and General Bowley's death certificate are included in this file.

did.unittitle: Sympathy Letters to Elsie When A.J. Bowley died
Sympathy Letters to Elsie When A.J. Bowley died, cont.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Sympathy notes from friends of Elsie and General Bowley. There are also many cards from flower arrangements sent to Elsie.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: More sympathy letters and cards from friends and family

did.unittitle: Invitations to Truman and Eisenhower Inaugurals

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Marriage announcements, cards, church programs, graduation invitations, Valentine cards, Christmas cards,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This file consists of newspaper and magazine clippings, progams, documents, invitations, and other miscellaneous realia.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This file consists of mostly poetry cut out from newspapers. There are also typed and hand written copies of poems. There is one poem written for 'My little friend Elsie Ball.'

did.unittitle: Sympathy Letters to Elsie When Brother Thomas Died

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This file consists of letters written to Elsie when her brother, Thomas Ball, died.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Miscellaneous documents, a few letters, and a few newspaper clippings

did.unittitle: Certificates from Commonwealth of Virginia for Membership of the Board of Regents of the James Monroe Law Office
Photograph of A. I. du Pont

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This file consists of photographs of places as identified on the back incluing early photographs of Miami Florida at the Everglades Hotel, likley taken by Isabel Ball Baker. It includes a photograph of Mary Ball Washington's grave and Ella Gresham Haile's grave. There are photographs dated 1931-1934 of the Bowley's home in Oahu, Hawaii, at the Schofield Barracks, and a photograph of Unity Church in Santa Ana, California.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This file consists of four photographs. Three photographs are of pocket watches and the other is of a chandelier. One of the pocket watches is inscripted with 'to George Washington from John Wentworth Stark.'

did.unittitle: Unidentified Photographs (most likely of Elsie and her family and friends)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This file contains photographs ranging from 1923-1970. It includes portraits of Elsie and Thomas Ball Wright and a photograph from Palm Beach. Some of the square photographs are labled as Mrs. Du Pont's seventieth birthday in 1968.

did.unittitle: Photographs of People (as identified on back)
Wedding Photographs of A. J. Bowley and Elsie Ball Wright

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: There are eleven c. late 1920s-early 1930s era photographs of Alameda, California buildings, churchs, neiborhoods, parks, etc. There are 8 inch x 10 inch interior views of an unidentified mansion and five photographic images of Sequoya Park, Eureka, California by the Freeman Art Company.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Many of the photographs are taken in Asia

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: One photograph was a gift to Mr. and Mrs. Bowley from Alfred and Molly Psai.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This file consists of a photograph of President Magsaysay and Pedro Paguio given to Isabel Baker on June 23, 1959. There is also a print of President Magsaysay indicated that it was acquired during Mrs. Baker's visit to Manila, Philippines in 1959, and there is an itenerary of the trip.
